content: Despite having been working in these three primary fields for over a decade now, from youth until my current place in college, I do not really have a lot to show for it, as I never really archived much of my old work, so the showcase is somewhat lacking; however, with my recent onset of classes and creation kicks on YouTube, I do have some recent content, even not in quantity, but it is relatively high quality.

My "portfolio" work for my web dev class mostly consists of Labs, obviously, including this page, which, until this point, where incredibly rudamentary and at a time whenever I did not understand / did not know HTML, CSS, or JS.

The labs took place over the course of a single semester, with this page being the midterm (Foxtrot). The pages are separated into two distinct categories: Introductory and Intermediate. This page, Foxtrot, is the last of the Introductory pages.

Below you can find a link to the page full of the labs.
These labs were constructed over the Fall 2023 semester in my Junior year at college.

My foray into graphic design began as early as age 10 with making thumbnails for videos on my old YouTube channels; however, as time went on, the operations expanded, and I began to make banners, profile pictures, graphics for streams, and for events.

Much of my recent work was directly tied to the Esports organization at my University of which I was apart and for the my work on the L4D2 Beta Pack Project. Over the course of my time with both organizations my skills increased dramatically.

Below you can find a link to the page full of my graphic work.
While much of these graphics are recent, some are legacy content, so quality will vary.
